site.title: Zodial
site.description: Find your place in the cosmos. Explore the zodiac and learn more about your astrological sign.
site.content: The zodiac is the belt or band of constellations through which the Sun, Moon, and planets move on their journey across the sky. Learn more about how it affects your personality by exploring the links below.

pages.name: Signs
pages.description: There are 12 zodiac signs, each representing a  30°  division of celestial longitude.

pages.name: Elements
pages.description: The twelve zodiac signs are grouped into four elements.
pages.content: Empedocles — fifth-century BC Greek philosopher — identified Fire, Earth, Air, and Water as the basic building blocks of the universe. Classification according to the elements has gained such importance that some astrologers start their interpretation of a natal chart by studying the balance of the elements.

pages.name: Modalities
pages.description: Each of the four elements manifests in three modalities.
pages.content: Each of the four elements manifests in three modalities: Cardinal, Fixed and Mutable. As each modality comprehends four signs, these are also known as Quadruplicities. The combination of element and modality provides a basic sign characterization.

pages.name: Polarities
pages.description: The polarity of a sign is mirrored by the one opposite on the zodiac.

pages.name: Celestial Bodies
pages.description: Each astrological sign is ruled by a single celestial body.

elements.name: Fire
elements.description: Fire has to deal with bravery.

elements.name: Air
elements.description: Air has to deal with playfulness and wits.

elements.name: Earth
elements.description: Earth has to deal with loyalty.

elements.name: Water
elements.description: Water has to deal with emotion, intuition, and intelligence.

modalities.name: Cardinal
modalities.description: The Cardinal modality marks the beginning of the season and the power of initiation.

modalities.name: Fixed
modalities.description: The Fixed modality corresponds to the middle of the season and the power of sustaining.

modalities.name: Mutable
modalities.description: The Mutable modality represents the end of the season and the power of change.

polarities.name: Positive
polarities.description: Six of the zodiac signs are yang energy, which is also known as “masculine” energy. These signs are more active and assertive rather than receptive.

polarities.name: Negative
polarities.description: Six of the zodiac signs are yin energy, which is also known as “feminine” energy. These signs are more receptive and reactive rather than active.

celestial-bodies.name: Sun
celestial-bodies.description: The Sun tells us of the actual core of a person, the inner self, of that which is of central concern. It also shows us the general vitality and the ability to assert oneself, it describes a general tone of being which colors everything else.

celestial-bodies.name: Moon
celestial-bodies.description: The Moon represents our feelings and emotions, the receptivity, imagination and basic feeling tone of a person. It also has an effect on the sense of rhythm, time and timing, it influences our adaptability to change, our mobility and versatility.

celestial-bodies.name: Mercury
celestial-bodies.description: Mercury represents reason, reasonableness (common sense), that which is rational. It stands for the spoken and written word, putting in order, weighing and evaluating, the process of learning and skills.

celestial-bodies.name: Venus
celestial-bodies.description: Venus gives us a sense of beauty, the enjoyment of pleasure, aesthetic awareness, love of harmony, sociability, taking pleasure in relationships and eroticism.

celestial-bodies.name: Mars
celestial-bodies.description: Mars represents the energy and drive of a person, their courage, determination, the freedom of spontaneous impulse. It also describes the readiness for action, the way one goes about doing things as well as simple aggression.

celestial-bodies.name: Jupiter
celestial-bodies.description: The search for individual meaning and purpose, optimism, hope and a sense of justice are represented by Jupiter. So also faith, a basic philosophy of life, the striving for spiritual growth and expansion.

celestial-bodies.name: Saturn
celestial-bodies.description: Saturn shows how we experience reality, where we meet with resistance and discover our limitations. It represents the conscience and moral conviction, the laws and rules which we choose to obey. It also tells us about  our powers of endurance and the ability to concentrate, it lends qualities like earnestness, caution and reserve.

celestial-bodies.name: Uranus
celestial-bodies.description: Uranus stands for intuition, it transmits sudden inspiration and lightning insights. An openness for all that is new, unknown and unusual. A sort of wrong-headed contrariness is also associated with this planet. It is said to be characteristic of astrology as such.

celestial-bodies.name: Neptune
celestial-bodies.description: This planet gives us the supersensory, opens doors to mystical experience and the transcendental. On this level it is hard to discern where perception moves into deception, illusion and false appearances, and so Neptune is associated with all of these, with drugs and all kinds of pseudo-realities.

celestial-bodies.name: Pluto
celestial-bodies.description: Pluto describes how we deal with power, personal and non-personal, be it through suffering the power of others or exercising it ourselves. It describes how we meet the demonic and magical, our regenerative powers and our capacity for radical change and rebirth: the cycles of dying and becoming.

moon phases.name: New Moon
moon phases.time for: planning and conceiving, recharging, opening yourself up, setting new goals

moon phases.name: First Quarter Moon
moon phases.time for: staying focused, committing to the task

moon phases.name: Disseminating Moon
moon phases.time for: reaping benefits, engaging with others and getting ready

moon phases.name: Last Quarter Moon
moon phases.time for: leaving the past behind and working on hopes, goals and dreams
